Body: I'm trying to figure out what's using my battery life by looking at the battery page in Settings. (I don't know if this screen is Cyanogen specific, or a stock Android feature.) Here's a recent screenshot of that page:Transcript:  Current battery level: 67%    Use since last full charge:      Android System: 3%  Screen: 2%  Cell Standby: 2%  Ironclad Tactics: 2%  Google App: 1%  Android OS: 1%  Google Play Services: 1%  (It may not be clear from the screenshot, but that's the end of the list: there's nothing off-screen.) I don't know whether those percentages are supposed to add up to 100% (logical) or to 33% (the amount of battery used so far), but either way, they actually add up to 12%. No amount of rounding error can explain that. At best, 2/3 of my battery usage is totally unaccounted for.This is a common occurrence. I have another screenshot where my battery level is 18%, but the sum of all the used apps is only 44%.What could be using up so much battery that wouldn't show on this list? Or alternately, could some battery usage pattern could cause this screen to grossly underestimate usage of a particular app? Or could a faulty battery, that drains more quickly than it should for a given load, cause this?
Title: Why don't the percentages on the battery chart add up to anywhere near 100%?

history.Text: I'm trying to figure out what's using my battery life by looking at the battery page in Settings. (I don't know if this screen is Cyanogen specific, or a stock Android feature.) Here's a recent screenshot of that page:[![Battery usage chart][1]][2]Transcript:> **Current battery level: 67%**> > Use since last full charge:> >   - Android System: 3%>   - Screen: 2%>   - Cell Standby: 2%>   - Ironclad Tactics: 2%>   - Google App: 1%>   - Android OS: 1%>   - Google Play Services: 1%(It may not be clear from the screenshot, but that's the end of the list: there's nothing off-screen.) I don't know whether those percentages are supposed to add up to 100% (logical) or to 33% (the amount of battery used so far), but either way, they actually add up to 12%. No amount of rounding error can explain that. At best, 2/3 of my battery usage is totally unaccounted for.This is a common occurrence. I have another screenshot where my battery level is 18%, but the sum of all the used apps is only 44%.What could be using up so much battery that wouldn't show on this list? Or alternately, could some battery usage pattern could cause this screen to grossly underestimate usage of a particular app? Or could a faulty battery, that drains more quickly than it should for a given load, cause this?  [1]: http://i.stack.imgur.com/mJQNZm.png  [2]: http://i.stack.imgur.com/mJQNZ.png
Why don't the percentages on the battery chart add up to anywhere near 100%?
